conclusion: Analyze the acceleration-time graph to determine when velocity is at maximum by integrating acceleration over time.
The image shows an acceleration-time graph with acceleration starting at 2 m/s² at t = 0, constant until t = 2 s, then decreasing linearly to 0 m/s² at t = 4 s.
Acceleration is 2 m/s² from t = 0 to t = 2 s.
Calculate area under acceleration curve from t = 0 to t = 2 s: 4 m/s.
From t = 2 s to t = 4 s, acceleration decreases linearly from 2 m/s² to 0 m/s².
Calculate area under acceleration curve from t = 2 s to t = 4 s: 2 m/s.
Total change in velocity from t = 0 to t = 4 s is 6 m/s.
Maximum velocity is reached when total change in velocity is added to initial velocity (0 m/s).
Maximum velocity is 6 m/s, occurring at t = 4 s.
The object's velocity reaches its maximum at t = 4 s.
